content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Split the markdown document into an array of lines
    lines = split(md, "\n")

    # Initialize an empty string to store the extracted code
    code = ""

    # Iterate through each line in the markdown document
    for line in lines
        # If the current line is a Julia code fence, skip it and move on to the next line
        if line == "```julia" || line == "```"
            continue
        end

        # If the current line is not a Julia code fence, add it to the extracted code string
        code *= "$line\n"
    end

    return code
end
```
This function splits the markdown document into an array of lines using `split`, and then iterates through each line. If the current line is a Julia code fence, it skips it and moves on to the next line. If the current line is not a Julia code fence, it adds it to the extracted code string using `*=`. Finally, it returns the extracted code as a string.
